image.altText: Maira Cappiello

props.synopsis: Maira Cappiello says she felt alone despite being in the centre of town when the alleged assault occurred on Wednesday morning.

title.children: Woman allegedly sexually assaulted by 10yo in Cairns says her home is now her nightmare

image.altText: The High Court on the shores of Lake Burley Griffin. There are dark clouds over the building, and a seagull in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The High Court dismisses a case brought by an Iranian man demanding to be released from immigration detention after refusing to cooperate with efforts to deport him.

title.children: High Court sides with government in case of Iranian man resisting deportation

image.altText: Photo illustration of Bruce Lehrmann with wood panelling and Australian emblem of Federal Court in Sydney in the background.

props.synopsis: Parties in Bruce Lehrmann's failed defamation case against Channel Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson are back in the Federal Court in Sydney to hear Justice Michael Lee's decision on costs. Follow live.

title.children: Judge set to rule on costs in Bruce Lehrmann's failed defamation case

image.altText: Peter Vinnicombe wears glasses.

props.synopsis: When a traumatic job caused paramedic Peter Vinnicombe to fear for his life, he was plunged into a deep depression. Despite the honour he felt serving as a paramedic, he doesn't think support for former first responders is good enough.

title.children: A routine call-out for paramedic Peter Vinnicombe resulted in horrific trauma that ended his career

image.altText: Two purple and white planes on a tarmac, seen through a chainlink fence.

props.synopsis: Administrators say up to 20 parties are interested in saving the embattled airline as debts of $116 million are revealed at the first creditors' meeting.

title.children: Investors, airlines and travel companies in talks to save Bonza, administrators tell first creditors' meeting

image.altText: A white teenage boy with fair hair and Down syndrome sitting on the ground

props.synopsis: Remembering their son Finlay brings smiles to his parents' faces — but the pain of losing him to what they believe was a preventable death is undeniable.

title.children: 'Kick in the guts': The death certificate detail that made the loss of Finlay Browne even more painful

image.altText: Allan Hopkins

props.synopsis: Police are calling for public assistance after a convicted child rapist who is facing new serious sex offence allegations, has fled South Australia.

title.children: SA, QLD police search for convicted child rapist accused of new serious sex offence

image.altText: A composite image of an older man and an older woman smiling.

props.synopsis: The jury in the murder trial of former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn over the deaths of Carol Clay and Russell Hill has been discharged, less than 24 hours after it was empanelled.

title.children: Victorian campers murder trial jury discharged moments before opening arguments

image.altText: Cam MCarthy raises his right hand in celebration as he runs across the football ground.

props.synopsis: Former Fremantle and Greater Western Sydney forward Cam McCarthy dies after being found unresponsive at a home in Perth's south — the fourth tragic death among ex-Dockers players in recent years.

title.children: 'This is unbelievably sad': Former AFL player Cam McCarthy dead at 29

image.altText: Matthew Dickerson speaking in front of a microphone

props.synopsis: The alleged incident occurred during a karaoke afterparty involving Japanese officials from the town of Minokamo and a visiting delegation from the New South Wales town of Dubbo.

title.children: 'I was drunk': Japanese official accused of inappropriate behaviour to visiting daughter of Australian mayor

image.altText: A bulldozer rips up rows of vines.

props.synopsis: Too much wine might not seem like a problem, but take a drive through Australian wine country and you'll quickly see how a global glut has created a crisis.

title.children: Younger people aren't drinking wine, and there's too much for sale

image.altText: GPS tracker on an ankle with person wearing a black shoe.

props.synopsis: Less than half of the 153 former immigration detainees released into the community after a High Court ruling last year are subject to electronic monitoring and curfews, the federal government says.

title.children: The government passed a law last year to put ankle bracelets on released detainees. Only half have to wear them

image.altText: An Israeli and Australian flag next to a Free Gaza camp sign

props.synopsis: A university spokesperson says the attack on an academic's office has been "conflated" with protests between two camps in support of Palestine and Israel on campus, but did not elaborate further.

title.children: Urine attack not linked to student protests against Israel's siege on Gaza, University of Queensland says

image.altText: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk addressing media during resignation

props.synopsis: The former Queensland premier talks about life post-politics and her new job at the Smart Energy Council, but won't confirm whether she will join her successor Steven Miles on the state election campaign trail this year.

title.children: Annastacia Palaszczuk steers clear of state politics as she takes up new job

image.altText: A photo of a person in an online meeting with the person's head is blurred.

props.synopsis: The ANU has promised to take swift action if an investigation finds Nazi gestures were used at an online students' association meeting this week.

title.children: Australian National University investigating if Nazi gestures were used at student association meeting

image.altText: An older man in a coat speaks into a microphone on marble steps in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: Robert F Kennedy Jr struggled with memory loss and brain fog so severe his friends were concerned he had a tumour. Instead, he says, doctors found a parasite.

title.children: Robert F Kennedy says a worm 'ate a portion' of his brain, 'then died'. What can a brain parasite do?

image.altText: A sketch of a blonde woman sitting in a court room with a screen in front of her.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's attorney's aggressively seeks to discredit Stormy Daniels's story of an alleged sexual encounter that led to a hush money payment.

title.children: 'You made all this up': Stormy Daniels faces accusations in heated cross-examination during Donald Trump hush money trial

image.altText: A man with short grey hair and a green plaid shirt gives the camera a half smile.

props.synopsis: A father-of-two from Victoria has his world turned upside down by an immigration law repealed in 2002. When he spoke to the ABC, the Department of Immigration changed its tune.

title.children: Australian man stunned to find out he lost his citizenship 33 years ago due to now-defunct law

image.altText: Anthony Monteleone, who has been accused of stabbing his former girlfriend outside a south Sydney gym

props.synopsis: Anthony Monteleone, 45, has been charged with cause wounding/grievous bodily harm to person with intent to murder (DV) and breaching an apprehended domestic violence order.

title.children: Man accused of stabbing ex-girlfriend in Sydney car park was on intensive corrections order at time of attack

image.altText: A still from a video showing a confrontation between two men standing up as others watch on.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation uncovers a series of allegations by former workers blowing the whistle on mistreatment, neglect and excessive use of force against people with disabilities being cared for by NDIS provider Evolution Support Services.

title.children: Jake's support worker tells him to settle down. Seconds later, there's a sickening crack and a cry of pain

image.altText: Man holds sign saying 'real men stand with women' among other protesters at the violence against women rally in Sydney.

props.synopsis: All men can play a role in shifting the harmful beliefs and culture that drives violence against women. Experts explain how.

title.children: How men can help prevent violence against women, starting today

image.altText: close up of side of Scott Morrison's face

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Scott Morrison said he wanted a woman to replace him in the very safe seat of Cook. What happened instead has been described as "blatant, arrogant and overt" — a concerted campaign driven by some of the country's most influential figures.

title.children: A prime minister's seat up for grabs, the backlash in the battle for Cook

image.altText: King charles wearing a grey suit and smiling

props.synopsis: The monarch said he was happy to take the opportunity to visit the military school where he engaged with personnel and their families.

title.children: King Charles jokes about being 'allowed out of my cage' as he visits military college

image.altText: Joe Biden speaks at a microphone with an American flag behind him.

props.synopsis: As the US president threatens to pull back on his support for Israel, his election opponent makes headlines for very different reasons as Stormy Daniels appears in court.

title.children: Biden's red line, Trump's make-or-break moment and a brain worm: US politics takes some unusual turns

image.altText: A young girl is silhouetted against fading evening sun holding a football in one hand while walking across sand dune ridge

props.synopsis: In the shadow of Uluru, an unprecedented football carnival was quietly held for young First Nations women from remote communities. More than sport was at play.

title.children: Hidden from view, a remarkable football carnival took place near Uluru

image.altText: Penny Wong at a press conference standing in front of an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Australia's Foreign Minister Penny Wong says negotiations about a United Nations vote to adopt Palestine as part of its body are still underway and the country's position has not been finalised.

title.children: 'Not a question of if' but when Australia will recognise Palestinian state says Penny Wong

image.altText: Caucasian man in a suit and tie, outside walking towards court

props.synopsis: George Burgess is found not guilty of one charge of sexually touching a woman without consent over an incident in March 2022.

title.children: Former NRL player George Burgess cleared of groping allegations

image.altText: Koren Helbig smiles while standing next to a compost bin in a sunny, lush garden.

props.synopsis: The days are cooling, and the nights are turning crisp. Here are five jobs I'm prioritising this season for my backyard permaculture patch.

title.children: Remove your summer crops: Gardening tips for the change of season

image.altText: Two men stand together with their arms around each other

props.synopsis: Disappearances are not uncommon in Mexico. But in their haste to close the case of murdered surfers Jake and Callum Robinson and Carter Rhoad, local authorities leave a lot of questions unanswered.

title.children: 'The hallmarks of organised crime': What we don't know about the murder of two brothers in Mexico

image.altText: A family watches on from the deck of a business as food waters rise three meters

props.synopsis: It is said that good things come in threes, but not for the Wilsons. They've been battered by three floods in less than a year, forced to raise their roadhouse by three metres, and now face a $3 million damage bill.

title.children: This family moved to the outback for a fresh start. It turned out to be anything but

image.altText: Map of the Great Artesian Basin

props.synopsis: Accused by the Nationals of making a wrong call over a controversial carbon capture project, Liberal deputy leader Sussan Ley hits back, exposing a split at the highest levels of the Coalition.

title.children: Politicians are running a mile from a controversial carbon project that Gina Rinehart wants stopped

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Bank of England holds interest rates steady but the governor is "optimistic" about interest rate cuts while US indices lift, continuing a strong run. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street keeps lifting, Bank of England holds rates steady and ASX up

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Bonza founder apologises for airline's collapse
Orica uses a lot of gas, and currently gets it three times cheaper in North America

image.altText: Illustration of person in activewear sitting on an exercise ball and holding one hand high into the air, holding dumbbell.

props.synopsis: Weights training isn't just about getting ripped. Building muscles can stave off diseases and improve your quality of life as you age. These experts share ways to do it.

title.children: One in three Australians has pain. Building muscle can help — and you don't need to leave home to do it
